fullText:
Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Mookie Betts will be heading to the basketball court in February to coach at the Ruffles Celebrity Game during NBA All-Star weekend.

The NBA announced Betts as a coach for the game that will take place on Feb. 13 at the Kia Forum in Inglewood. ESPN‚Äôs Buster Olney was the first to report the news on Tuesday via X.

Dodgers superstar Mookie Betts will be coaching in the Ruffles Celeb Game in LA!

Friday, 2/13 at 7:00pm/et on ESPN

Get your tickets to the Ruffles Celeb Game: https://t.co/aVa6hMPMEjhttps://t.co/vP31bcmFyo

In addition to Betts, ESPN NBA insider Shams¬†Charania, rapper GloRilla and producer Mustard will participate in the Celebrity Game. The rosters for each team have yet to be finalized, so it has yet to be determined which celebrities Betts will coach.

Betts is not only a four-time World Series champion, an eight-time All-Star and the 2018 American League Most Valuable Player. But he is also a talented multi-sport athlete with hobbies such as golf, bowling and basketball.

He was seen playing basketball with NBA veteran Chris Paul in December shortly after the Los Angeles Clippers cut the future Hall of Famer. Betts also hosts an annual ‚ÄúMookie Betts + Friends Bowling Tournament‚Äù to help raise money for his 50/50 Foundation and recently played a round of golf with former United States president Barack Obama at Lakeside Golf Club in December.

After coaching the Celebrity Game, Betts will report to spring training with the Dodgers before the team‚Äôs first spraining training game against the Los Angeles Angels on Feb. 21.

Betts is coming off a strong season at shortstop, winning his first Gold Glove at the position in 2025. He and the Dodgers are looking to win a third straight World Series championship in 2026, and Betts will be a crucial part of achieving that feat.

Betts has the most World Series championships of any active player in MLB.

Winning another title would put Betts into an exclusive group of MLB players who have won five World Series throughout their careers. Former New York Yankees catcher Yogi Berra holds the all-time record with 10 World Series championships.

title: Could Giannis Antetokounmpo be on the radar for a Phoenix Suns trade?
description: PHOENIX ‚Äì When a superstar hints he may be ready for a new home, the NBA‚Äôs ecosystem shifts. Giannis Antetokounmpo has been the gravitational center of Milwaukee for a decade.
fullText:
PHOENIX ‚Äì When a superstar hints he may be ready for a new home, the NBA‚Äôs ecosystem shifts. Giannis Antetokounmpo has been the gravitational center of Milwaukee for a decade. Still, if the Bucks begin listening, every contender has to ask the uncomfortable question of what it takes to acquire his talents, and would it be worth it? Would the Phoenix Suns even entertain that question?

Feb 6, 2024; Phoenix, Arizona, USA; Detailed view of the jersey of Milwaukee Bucks forward Giannis Antetokounmpo (34) against the Phoenix Suns at Footprint Center. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports

For Phoenix, the answer starts with creativity. This wouldn‚Äôt be a clean, one-for-one blockbuster. It would likely be a multi-player constructed trade offer built around scoring upside and future flexibility. Jalen Green would be the most obvious trade piece. An explosive, high-variance scorer whose career has flashed elite shot creation fits the archetype Milwaukee would need to reset around youth and offense, even if injuries have limited his recent availability. Add in veteran connective tissue like Royce O‚ÄôNeale and the upside swing of Ryan Dunn, and suddenly the framework resembles something tangible, although the chances of the Phoenix Suns pulling the trigger on a trade that big right now seem slim.

Apr 1, 2025; Milwaukee, Wisconsin, USA; Milwaukee Bucks forward Giannis Antetokounmpo (34) drives for the basket against Phoenix Suns forward Oso Ighodaro (4) and guard Ryan Dunn (0) in the second quarter at Fiserv Forum. Mandatory Credit: Benny Sieu-Imagn Images

The data backs the temptation. Giannis remains a top-tier efficiency engine, combining rim pressure, playmaking gravity, and defensive impact that few players in history can match. Phoenix, meanwhile, has leaned heavily on stars whose availability has fluctuated. For Suns fans, the emotional math is harder. Not only does trading away talented youth hurt, but giving up on potential after a handful of games feels premature. Then there is the history behind the player, as Giannis Antetokounmpo helped deliver Milwaukee a title against Phoenix in the 2021 NBA Finals. Seeing him in a Suns jersey would feel like a glitch in the timeline.

Mar 24, 2025; Phoenix, Arizona, USA; Milwaukee Bucks forward Giannis Antetokounmpo (34) defends against Phoenix Suns guard Devin Booker (1) at Footprint Center. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-Imagn Images

But championships are built on uncomfortable bets. It would be an absolute long shot for Phoenix, though. The Suns have the pieces, the urgency, and the incentive to make the call at least. Whether they‚Äôre willing to pay the real price, or if that is even on the table, is the story worth monitoring.

title: Warriors' stance on trading Jimmy Butler for Giannis Antetokounmpo revealed by NBA insider
description: Golden State does love a blockbuster trade.
fullText:
Warriors' stance on trading Jimmy Butler for Giannis Antetokounmpo revealed by NBA insider originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Giannis Antetokounmpo is ready to move on from the Milwaukee Bucks -- and contenders around the NBA reportedly are making "aggressive" pitches to land the two-time MVP ahead of next Thursday's trade deadline.

One team almost guaranteed to kick the tires on Antetokounmpo is the Golden State Warriors. Though the hard-capped Warriors hardly have an asset warchest to offer the Bucks, Golden State can dangle a contract to match salaries that another team might not dangle -- or cannot dangle.

MORE:¬†Warriors make Giannis Antetokounmpo trade decision as Bucks star prepares to move on

The Warriors' trade deadline outlook -- and their season at large -- changed irrevocably when Jimmy Butler went down with a season-ending knee injury last Monday. Butler is signed through next season at a $56.8 million salary, and Sports Illustrated's Chris Mannix reports that the Warriors would offer Butler's contract -- plus Jonathan Kuminga -- in a deal to land Antetokounmpo.

The Warriors are willing to offer a Jonathan Kuminga/Jimmy Butler‚Äìheadlined package with draft picks for Giannis Antetokounmpo, per @SIChrisMannix

(Via @SInow ) pic.twitter.com/NUisKudSll

‚Äî NBACentral (@TheDunkCentral) January 28, 2026

Kuminga has been linked with the Miami Heat, the Sacramento Kings and the Los Angeles Lakers. His two-year, $48.5 million contract has a team option for next season, which could make him an attractive option for a team like the Bucks -- who are poised to retool once a Giannis trade is completed.

Even with the Bucks reject this offer, the Warriors seem intent on getting another star¬†before the deadline -- and if they don't, they may try again on Antetokounmpo in the summer.

title: NBA makes important Dillon Brooks announcement after Suns-Nets
description: The NBA has made an important decision on Dillon Brooks.
fullText:
NBA makes important Dillon Brooks announcement after Suns-Nets originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Dillon Brooks landed in some hot water with NBA officials on Tuesday night.

As the Phoenix Suns and the Brooklyn Nets battled it out, Brooks landed a technical foul after getting tangled up with his opponent. For Brooks, it was his 15th tech of the season, placing him one away from a suspension this year.

Fortunately, Brooks will not be in danger of suspension the next time he steps on the court. On Wednesday, the NBA announced that the technical foul had been rescinded upon league office review. That‚Äôs great news for the Suns, who have been fortunate to see Brooks take a major step for their team this season.

Brooks wrapped up Tuesday night‚Äôs action with 26 points off 9-15 shooting from the field, 2-5 from three, and 6-6 from the charity stripe. He added three rebounds, three assists, one steal, and one block in 34 minutes of action. The Suns defeated the Nets 106-102.

Since getting traded to the Suns from the Houston Rockets, Brooks has taken his game to another level.

In 41 matchups, the veteran forward has shot 44 percent from the field. He is attempting 7.0 threes per game, knocking down 34 percent of his shots from beyond the arc. The veteran forward is producing 20.5 points per game, which marks a new career-high for him. He is also producing 2.9 rebounds and 1.7 assists per game.

After a major offseason shakeup, the NBA world didn‚Äôt know what to make of the Suns this year. So far, they have been highly impressive. After a win over the Nets, the Suns are 29-19 on the year. They place sixth in the Western Conference, trailing the Los Angeles Lakers by one game.

Booker and the Suns will get Wednesday night off. They‚Äôll return to the court on Thursday for a home game against the Eastern Conference‚Äôs top squad, the Detroit Pistons.

title: Suns 'love our group' as trade deadline nears, Jalen Green returns
description: The 2026 NBA trade deadline is Feb. 5. Phoenix Suns head coach Jordan Ott explains where his head is at before the deadline.
fullText:
Jordan Ott‚Äôs primary focus as a first-year head coach has been on present, not the past or future.

So the way he first answered a question about the Feb. 5 trade deadline wasn‚Äôt surprising.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying to win a game tonight,‚Äù a smiling Ott said during pregame availability Jan. 27, as the Phoenix Suns (27-19) face the Brooklyn Nets (12-32) at Mortgage Matchup Center.

The Suns are seventh in the Western Conference and are playing above preseason predictions, but they‚Äôve made trade deadline moves before under team owner Mat Ishbia starting with the blockbuster Kevin Durant deal in 2023.

However, Ott said the Suns ‚Äúlove‚Äù the team currently constructed as they‚Äôre eyeing the return of Jalen Green moving forward.

Suns coach Jordan Ott on Feb. 5 trade deadline: "We have people in place in leadership to take care of a lot of that stuff. We know it's right around the corner, but we love our group. We continue to say that. Our group growing internally. Our big piece we're going to get back is‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/X7MkHgKaMG

‚Äî Duane Rankin (@DuaneRankin) January 28, 2026

‚ÄúWe have people in place in leadership to take care of a lot of that stuff,‚Äù Ott said. "We know it's right around the corner, but we love our group. We love our group. We continue to say that. Our group is growing internally. Our big piece we're going to get back is Jalen Green and that's what we're excited about.‚Äù

Phoenix can‚Äôt trade any first-round picks through 2032. The Suns can move their 2033 first-round pick the night of the 2026 draft.

Green missed a second straight game after tweaking his right hamstring in the first quarter of Friday‚Äôs loss to the Atlanta Hawks to end six-game road trip.

That was Green‚Äôs second game back after missing 33 consecutive games with what the Suns called a right hamstring strain. He‚Äôs only played four games in his first season with the Suns, who acquired him from the Houston Rockets in the Kevin Durant trade.

The Suns had an MRI on Green after the Atlanta game that revealed no new damage. Green has had two workouts since with the latest one after Tuesday‚Äôs morning shootaround.

‚ÄúEverything seems to be good,‚Äù Ott said. ‚ÄúWe'll continue to reassess. Get him back on the court when he's ready to go."

Ott has said Green is day-to-day, adding Tuesday that Green doesn‚Äôt need to do 5-on-5 to return to the court. Green had multiple 5-on-5 runs with teammates, coaches and staff before returning Jan. 20 against Philadelphia during the six-game road trip after missing 33 consecutive games.

‚ÄúHe had enough before he came back the last time,‚Äù Ott said. ‚ÄúIt's more just, feel good. We're right there. It's nothing new. That was helpful. Just ease the mind. He's been out two months so some of that is expected. It's a new era for him, too. He's never had something like this. When he feels right, he'll be back out there. Dying to get back out there. We're dying to have him out there, but we want to have him right."

Green is averaging a career-low 11.8 points in his four games with the Suns.

Phoenix is also down Devin Booker (right ankle sprain), Collin Gillespie (right hand sprain) and two-way player Isaiah Livers (illness).

Ott said Gillespie hurt his hand when falling to the floor in Sunday‚Äôs loss to the Miami Heat and that it‚Äôs a ‚Äúshort-term‚Äù injury. Booker sprained his right ankle in the third quarter of the Atlanta loss. The Suns announced Sunday, Jan. 25, that Booker would be re-evaluated in a week.

title: NBA results: January 27, 2026 ‚Äì winners and losers
description: Tuesday night in the NBA delivered drama, big performances, and tight finishes. Several teams snapped losing streaks, while others struggled to close games. Young stars made noise and veterans stepped up when needed. From last-second free throws to fourth-quarter takeovers,‚Ä¶
fullText:
Tuesday night in the NBA delivered drama, big performances, and tight finishes. Several teams snapped losing streaks, while others struggled to close games. Young stars made noise and veterans stepped up when needed. From last-second free throws to fourth-quarter takeovers, the night had a bit of everything. Here is a breakdown of the winners and losers from all the games.

Washington finally snapped its nine-game losing streak with a tough home win. Alex Sarr led the way with 29 points, 12 rebounds, and six blocks, staying aggressive all night. Kyshawn George and Bub Carrington made big plays late, while Khris Middleton calmly iced the game at the line. Even after getting crushed on the boards, the Wizards found timely buckets and ended a home losing run against Portland that stretched back to 2017.

Portland dominated the glass but couldn‚Äôt finish the job. Shaedon Sharpe scored 31 points, and Donovan Clingan added 14 points and 20 rebounds. Deni Avdija had a solid return with 17 points and 12 boards. Missed free throws and another late collapse cost them a winnable game.

New York owned the fourth quarter by outscoring Sacramento 31-15. Jalen Brunson led the charge with 28 points and took control late. Karl-Anthony Towns added 17 points and 11 rebounds. Mikal Bridges chipped in with 18 points and OG Anunoby had 15. The Knicks forced the pace and turned defense into offense. Mike Brown also earned his first win against Sacramento since leaving the team. Even with 21 turnovers, New York stayed composed when it mattered most.

Sacramento lost its sixth straight game and struggled badly from deep. The team shot just 5 of 30 from three-point range. DeMar DeRozan scored 34 points but had little help. Russell Westbrook added 14 points but could not spark a rally. Their offense went cold in the fourth quarter and they could not keep up with New York‚Äôs run. Poor shooting and weak defense in the final period sealed their fate.

Philadelphia bounced back after a blowout loss the night before. Paul George scored 32 points and hit nine three-pointers. Joel Embiid had 29 points and scored 18 in the first quarter alone. Tyrese Maxey added 22 points and kept the offense moving. The Sixers played with fresh energy after both stars returned from rest. Their shooting and ball movement overwhelmed Milwaukee. The win also showed how different this team looks with its main players healthy.

Milwaukee played without Giannis Antetokounmpo and felt his absence. Myles Turner scored 31 points and Ryan Rollins added 24, but defense was the issue. The Bucks allowed too many open looks from three. Bobby Portis and Kyle Kuzma each had 17 points but could not stop the Sixers‚Äô runs. Injuries continued to hurt their rhythm and depth.

Oklahoma City avoided a third straight loss despite missing several key players. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 29 points and stayed perfect at the line. Chet Holmgren delivered 20 points, 14 rebounds, and five blocks. Isaiah Joe added 17 points off the bench. The Thunder stayed steady during a late Pelicans push. Strong defense and patience helped them close the game.

New Orleans could not finish its comeback after cutting the lead to five. Zion Williamson had 21 points and 11 rebounds on efficient shooting. Saddiq Bey added 16 points and 13 rebounds. Tempers flared late and the flow of the game slipped away from them. Missed chances in the final minutes cost them a third-quarter rally.

Detroit continued its strong run and held off a late Denver charge. Tobias Harris scored 22 points and hit two clutch free throws. Cade Cunningham finished with 22 points and 11 assists. The Pistons built an early lead and survived missed shots down the stretch. Their balance and poise showed again in a tight finish.

Denver struggled with travel issues and missing players. Jamal Murray had 24 points and 10 assists but missed key free throws late. Jonas Valanciunas posted 16 points and 16 rebounds in his return. Fatigue and injuries hurt their execution. The rally fell short after several missed chances.

Phoenix won despite missing key scorers. Mark Williams had 27 points and Dillon Brooks added 26. Grayson Allen chipped in with 18 points. The Suns survived a late Nets run and closed the game with defense and free throws. Even after a scuffle broke out, they stayed focused and finished strong.

Brooklyn lost its sixth straight game. Michael Porter Jr. scored a season-high 36 points but got little support. Egor Demin added 15 points. The Nets could not hold a late lead and struggled with second scoring options. Emotions ran high and technical fouls did not help their cause.

The Clippers erased an early deficit with a huge second and third quarter. Kawhi Leonard led the comeback and stayed steady late. Kris Dunn sparked a big third-quarter surge with defense and playmaking. Los Angeles outscored Utah 36-20 in the third and never looked back. The win moved them closer to a .500 record.

Utah started fast but faded after halftime. Lauri Markkanen led early but struggled later. The Jazz could not handle the Clippers‚Äô pressure defense. Scoring dried up in the second half and the lead slipped away quickly. Another loss showed their trouble finishing games.

January 27 brought strong wins for teams like Washington, New York, and Philadelphia. Young stars like Alex Sarr and Chet Holmgren made a clear impact. Veteran leaders such as Kawhi Leonard and Paul George also delivered when needed. On the losing side, missed free throws and cold shooting proved costly for several teams. The night showed how small moments can decide close NBA games.

title: Dodgers superstar to coach NBA All-Star Celebrity Game
description: Eight-time All-Star Los Angeles Dodgers standout Mookie Betts will serve as a coach in this year's LA-set NBA All-Star Celebrity Game.
fullText:
Dodgers superstar to coach NBA All-Star Celebrity Game originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Fresh off winning his second straight World Series title (and his fourth overall), eight-time All-Star Los Angeles Dodgers standout Mookie Betts is going to further entrench himself into the L.A. sports universe with an appearance on the sidelines of the Clippers' homecourt, Intuit Dome, in two weeks.

Per the NBA's All-Star Weekend X account, the¬†seven-time Silver Slugger honoree and six-time Gold Glove winner will serve as a coach for the Ruffles Celebrity Game on Friday, Feb. 13.

Among the freshly-announced participants are two big names from the music world, Grammy-winning producer Mustard and hip-hop star GloRilla, the league has announced.

Tickets¬†for the event are available now.

So far, the All-Star Game's 10 starters have been announced.¬†Two-time MVP Milwaukee Bucks power forward Giannis Antetokounmpo, 2024 Finals MVP Boston Celtics swingman Jaylen Brown, two-time All-NBA New York Knicks point guard Jalen Brunson, Detroit Pistons point guard Cade Cunningham, and Philadelphia 76ers point guard Tyrese Maxey have been named to the Eastern Conference's first five.

Antetokounmpo, however, will miss at least the next four-to-six weeks with a calf strain, meaning he'll have to be replaced in this starting unit.

In the West, two-time MVP Golden State Warriors point guard Stephen Curry, three-time MVP Denver Nuggets center Nikola Jokic, 2024 West Finals MVP Los Angeles Lakers guard Luka Doncic, reigning MVP Oklahoma City Thunder point guard Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, and San Antonio Spurs center Victor Wembanyama.

Jokic has been out for several weeks already with a knee injury, and it's possible that he, like Antetokounmpo, could miss out on the action.

title: Elite athletes use the 4 p.m rule for better hydration and performance, says a top nutritionist
description: A sports nutritionist for NBA champs explains why athletes stop drinking water after 4 p.m. to optimize hydration and perform their best.
fullText:
NBA champions don't have time for morning brain fog or an afternoon slump.

Their secret to staying sharp all day long: perfectly-timed water breaks, according to a top sports nutritionist.

Matt Jones, who worked with the Boston Celtics during their 2024 NBA Championship-winning season and advises the supplement brand Cadence, said the pros have mastered the art of optimal hydration.

"Fueling intentionally is probably one of the biggest things we can take from the world of professional sport," he told Business Insider. "Professional athletes are very good at repeating basic behaviors like hydrating, and it's those routines that allow them to perform to the best of their ability."

If you want to level up your hydration game, start paying attention to how much you drink and when, Jones recommends.

After years of experience coaching elite athletes and military professionals, he has five key tips for getting enough water and electrolytes for better performance throughout the day.

Staying hydrated makes a big difference to your brain and body in the office or on the basketball court, Jones said.

"It can impact your mood, your decision-making; it can impact the way you just go about your normal life," he said.

Research suggests that mild or moderate dehydration can impair reaction time and memory. Physically, being dehydrated can reduce strength and endurance, and make it more difficult to recover after exercise.

Jones uses a gold-standard test to see if his athletes need to drink more water. It can tell you if you're dehydrated based on three symptoms:

Everyone's water needs are different, based on how much energy you use.

Jones said the gold standard recommendation is 1 milliliter to 1.5 milliliters per calorie of energy expenditure (in normal conditions). Two liters ‚Äî or that eight cups of water a day you've probably heard about ‚Äî makes sense for someone who burns 2,000 calories a day, but you may need more or less depending on your body size and activity level.

Sleeping is a superpower for athletes, and a simple tip helps them stay well-hydrated without too many overnight bathroom trips.

Jones said the solution for his athletes, including the Celtics, is to drink 80% of their fluids for the day before 4 p.m. so that their bodies have time to process all that liquid before bedtime.

Plain water should be your first priority for hydration, but other drinks and even foods can count toward your daily total.

For instance, your morning brew can help keep you hydrated, since caffeinated drinks in moderation lead to a net gain in fluid. Just steer clear of artificially sweetened or sugary beverages, too much of which can cause health issues like chronic inflammation over time.

Hydrating foods such as fruits and veggies also provide electrolytes to regulate the fluids in your body.

Sodium, or salt, is a key electrolyte, but you probably get enough in your diet already. Instead, Jones said to focus on potassium to offset the side effects of too much sodium, such as high blood pressure.

Good sources of potassium include bananas, avocados, coconut water, pomegranate, and watermelon.

Dehydration can sneak up on you before you realize it, especially if you're sweating a lot.

"During intense exercise, particularly in warm environments, thirst is not a good indicator of hydration status," Jones said. "People are often chasing their tails a little bit."

You can calculate your sweat rate to estimate just how much water you need to replace during exercise, like Jones does with the pros.

Prevent a dip in performance by drinking water at regular intervals.

"The first priority as soon as your big toe hits planet earth in the morning is to rehydrate," Jones said.

title: Doncic's scoring streak continues as Lakers beat Bulls
description: Luka Doncic keeps up his scoring streak with 46 points against the Chicago Bulls to become the quickest Los Angeles Lakers player to reach 2,000 NBA points.
fullText:
Luka Doncic put on another scoring masterclass with 46 points as the Los Angeles Lakers claimed a 129-118 victory at the Chicago Bulls.

The Slovenia guard's haul included eight three-pointers, and he also registered seven rebounds and 12 assists at the United Center to end the Bulls' four-game unbeaten run.

Doncic becomes the quickest Laker to reach 2,000 points - achieving the feat in his 65th game since he was traded by the Dallas Mavericks last February.

It was the fourth match in a row that the 26-year-old has finished with more than 30 points and he tops the NBA scoring charts with an average of 33.8 points per game.

He joins Kobe Bryant as the only players in Lakers history with at least 45 points, 10 assists and five three-pointers in a single game.

LeBron James added 24 points, five rebounds and three assists for the Lakers with Rui Hachimura hitting 23 points off the bench.

Despite Doncic's achievements, Lakers coach JJ Redick admitted after the game that the superstar still gives him some anxious moments on the sidelines.

"He's an engine that's fully on and he likes to create out there and that's part of what makes him a great player," he said.

"Because I played with him, I have a pretty good understanding of that - not to say it doesn't test your patience at times.

"You have to be willing to live with some of the stuff he tries because more often than not you will get a great result."

title: Dub Nation Demands Respect After Warriors Star Is Snubbed in NBA Rising Stars Announcement
description: The NBA released the list of participants for the Castrol Rising Stars for the 2026 All-Star Weekend. A list intended to celebrate the league‚Äôs future stars turned into disrespect for Golden State Warriors fans.
fullText:
The NBA released the list of participants for the Castrol Rising Stars for the 2026 All-Star Weekend. A list intended to celebrate the league‚Äôs future stars turned into disrespect for Golden State Warriors fans. With multiple teams getting more than one selection on both rookie and sophomore teams, Dub Nation found not even one of theirs on the list.

Two years ago, Brandin Podziemski was the sole selection for the Warriors. Last year, their representation increased to two players. This year, the Warriors were among the 15 teams without representation on the sophomore and rookie lists. The Dub Nation is one of the proudest fan bases, and giving them no representation invited voices calling out the league. ‚ÄúNot one Warrior smh,‚Äù a fan wrote, expressing discontent with the selection.

Let‚Äôs not forget, they were the most dominant team of the last decade, and produced stars like Stephen Curry and Klay Thompson. So, being denied entry into the list would surely warrant outrage from the fanbase. They were particularly upset with their rookie, Will Richard, getting no recognition.

In the past, several notable names haven‚Äôt made the Rising Star selection. Cam Whitmore, Tari Eason and Andrew Nembhard, who are gradually making their mark in the league, all missed the selection in 2024.

Isaiah Collier, one of the best bench players in the league, was one of the missing names last year. These past snubs have also attracted similar outrage from fans on social media.

The Warriors fans‚Äô discontent extended beyond representation. They boldly called out the league, with a fan demanding respect for one of their rookies. ‚ÄúRespect Will Richard.‚Äù The sentiment is certainly not baseless. The No. 56 pick in the 2025 NBA Draft has vastly outperformed expectations. He made his debut with a 13-point performance.

Richard has emerged as a consistent contributor from the bench. Steve Kerr has shown trust in him, and he won over fans in his first game. He plays on both ends, and his defensive mindset has earned him Rookie of the Year praise from fans on social media. ‚ÄúWill Richard snubbed,‚Äù a Warriors fan bluntly called out the selection.

However, it‚Äôs not only Warriors fans who had an issue with the lack of representation. Remember Hugo Gonzalez, Joe Mazzulla‚Äôs instinctive weapon? ‚ÄúHugo Gonzalez snubbed,‚Äù a Celtics fan was clearly upset with his name not being selected. Gonzalez became an instant favorite among the Celtics fans after he made the game-tying 3-pointer to send the game against the Brooklyn Nets into double overtime.

The Toronto Raptors had one selection. Collin Murray-Boyles, the rookie from Gamecocks, had slowly gotten himself into the starter‚Äôs role in the absence of Jakob P√∂ltl. However, a Raptors fan took issue with one player‚Äôs absence from the sophomore roster.

‚ÄúWhere is Jamal Shead?‚Äù one fan pointed out. Shead has emerged as the primary backup point guard for the Raptors this season. He is only behind Isaiah Collier for the most bench assists this season. Raptors fans‚Äô issue with him being snubbed was perhaps warranted.

Ace Bailey was one of the biggest snubs in the selection. He is the only player from the top 9 rookie selections from 2025 who didn‚Äôt make the cut. With Utah having no players on either team, some felt he should have made it.

However, with just 21 slots available, deserving players missing out is perhaps unavoidable. However, does it seal a player‚Äôs fate? Absolutely not.

title: Trinity Rodman is now the highest-paid women's soccer player in the world
description: Trinity Rodman, the daughter of NBA great Dennis Rodman, is making her own history in soccer.
fullText:
Trinity Rodman is now the highest-paid women's soccer player in the world originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Trinity Rodman has officially put pen to paper, ending months of uncertainty with a record-setting agreement that keeps her with the Washington Spirit through 2028.

Trinity Rodman is now reportedly the highest-paid women's soccer player in the world.

The 23-year-old forward signed a three-year deal with the Washington Spirit, where she started her career, valued at an estimated $2 million per year, when counting in bonuses.

The deal comes‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/8MMmCr1O3p

‚Äî PBS News (@NewsHour) January 26, 2026

The United States forward signed a new three-year contract worth more than $2 million per year, including bonuses, according to multiple reports. The deal makes Rodman the highest-paid player in NWSL history and, per her agent Mike Senkowski, the highest-paid women‚Äôs soccer player in the world. The announcement was made at an event in Los Angeles alongside Spirit owner Michele Kang and club executives, while Rodman continues training with the USWNT.

MORE:¬†Athlete cult favorite Jack in the Box announces 75th anniversary streetwear drop

‚ÄúIt feels amazing. I‚Äôm very happy, I‚Äôm very blessed,‚Äù Rodman said after signing. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs a monumental and game-changing moment right now.‚Äù She added that the deal aligns with her long-term vision, calling it ‚Äúperfect timing with the World Cup happening in the U.S.‚Äù

The agreement closes a chaotic chapter that began when Rodman‚Äôs previous contract expired on Dec. 31. Despite being the league‚Äôs most recognizable star, she entered the offseason without a deal, fueling speculation that she could leave the National Women's Soccer League entirely. Sources indicated that top clubs abroad ‚Äî particularly in England ‚Äî had made lucrative offers that Washington could not match under the league‚Äôs salary cap, which stood at $3.5 million per team in 2025.

In late November, Rodman and the Spirit reportedly reached a creative four-year agreement that would have averaged more than $1 million per season. That proposal was later rejected by the league, with commissioner Jessica Berman ruling that it violated league rules. The NWSL also accused Rodman of attempting to circumvent the cap, prompting the NWSL Players Association to file a grievance on her behalf, calling the intervention a violation of the collective bargaining agreement.

As the standoff intensified, the league‚Äôs board of governors approved a new High Impact Player (HIP) rule in December, allowing teams to exceed the salary cap by up to $1 million for certain star players. Spirit president of soccer operations Haley Carter confirmed that Rodman‚Äôs new contract benefited from the implementation of that rule.

‚ÄúNot only me personally but all of us at the Spirit are profoundly grateful that she has chosen to stay with us,‚Äù Kang said, referencing the ‚Äúvery compelling alternatives‚Äù Rodman had elsewhere.

MORE:¬†Ex-NFL QB Kellen Mond roasts former head coach: 'Leadership is an atmosphere you create'

Rodman, drafted second overall by Washington in 2021, helped deliver the club‚Äôs first NWSL championship as a rookie and has remained its centerpiece ever since.

title: NBA top pick Flagg among 28 named to Rising Stars event
description: Dallas Mavericks 19-year-old forward Cooper Flagg, the top pick in last year's NBA Draft, was among 28 players selected on Monday for the NBA Rising Stars tournament player pool.The 11 second-year players and 10 rookies selected by NBA assistant coaches will be drafted onto three teams on Tuesday with the G-League squad chosen by the league office.
fullText:
Dallas Mavericks 19-year-old forward Cooper Flagg, the top pick in last year's NBA Draft, was among 28 players selected on Monday for the NBA Rising Stars tournament player pool.

Flagg is averaging 18.8 points, 6.4 rebounds and 4.1 assists a game for the Mavs, who at 19-27 rank 12th in the Western Conference.

Three seven-player teams of NBA rookies and second-year players and a fourth of talent from the developmental G-League will play two games to 40 points on February 13 in Los Angeles during All-Star weekend festivities, with the winners meeting in the event final, which goes to 25 points.

The 11 second-year players and 10 rookies selected by NBA assistant coaches will be drafted onto three teams on Tuesday with the G-League squad chosen by the league office.

Former NBA Hall of Fame players Carmelo Anthony, Vince Carter and Tracy McGrady will each guide one of the clubs with Austin Rivers, a former player now serving as a television commentator, will coach the G-League team.

Other rookies selected include Philadelphia guard V.J. Edgecombe of the Bahamas, Russian guard Egor Demin of Brooklyn and Americans Dylan Harper of San Antonio, Kon Knueppel of Charlotte, Cedric Coward of Memphis, Derik Queen and Jeremiah Fears of New Orleans, Tre Johnson of Washington and Collin Murray-Boles of Toronto.

fullText:

Castle is the reigning Rookie of the Year for the San Antonio Spurs, and Flagg is the favorite to win the award this season amid a standout rookie campaign for the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Nets rookie Egor Demin to play in 2026 Rising Stars Game
description: The Nets will officially be represented at 2026 NBA All-Star weekend.
fullText:
The Nets will officially be represented at 2026 NBA All-Star weekend.

Brooklyn youngster Egor Demin has been selected to participate in the Rising Stars Game.

Demin is the 17th Net to be named to the event, and the first since Jarrett Allen and Rodions Kurucs in 2019.

He‚Äôs also the first BYU player to participate since Shawn Bradley in 1994.

The 19-year-old certainly has done enough to earn his spot during his outstanding first NBA campaign, and he's solidified himself as a key piece of Brooklyn‚Äôs backcourt moving forward.

Demin has started 31 of his 39 games, and he's topped double digits in points in 19 of those.

He currently ranks second among rookies in threes made per game (2.4) and threes made on the season (95).

The sharpshooter also set the franchise record for triples in a game with seven back on Dec. 29 against the Warriors.

title: Spurs announce trio of guards set for NBA Rising Stars challenge
description: The Spurs have announced a trio of Rising Stars.
fullText:
Spurs announce trio of guards set for NBA Rising Stars challenge originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The NBA announced on Monday evening that San Antonio Spurs sophomore Stephon Castle and rookie Dylan Harper have been selected to compete in the 2026 Castrol Rising Stars Game during NBA All-Star Weekend in Los Angeles.

It will mark the fifth time in franchise history that the Spurs have had multiple Rising Stars in the same season.

Harper has participated in 35 games and is averaging 10.2 points, 3.5 assists, and 3.3 rebounds in just 21 minutes per game. He is one of only five rookies to achieve these averages and the only rookie to do so without the support of a star player. Harper ranks among the top 10 rookies in assists, standing at No. 5, steals at No. 6, and scoring at No. 10. Earlier this season, he made history by becoming the youngest guard in NBA history to record a game with at least 20 points, 5 rebounds, 5 assists, and zero turnovers.

21-year-old Stephon Castle is set to make his second appearance in the Rising Stars event after winning last year's Rising Stars MVP and advancing to the All-Star Game in San Francisco. This season, he has started in 36 games, averaging career-best statistics of 16.9 points, 7.1 assists, 5.0 rebounds, and 1.30 steals in 31.0 minutes per game. This season, he became the fastest player in Spurs history to reach 1,500 points and 500 assists, accomplishing it in just 105 games.

Two-way guard 24-year-old David Jones Garcia is also representing them in Los Angeles. In nine regular-season games with the Austin Spurs, he leads the league in scoring with an impressive average of 26.8 points per game. He also set a career high by scoring 45 points against the Texas Legends.

title: Stephen Curry Shares Worrying Injury Update After Historic NBA Achievement Against Timberwolves
description: While Minnesota is supercharged with emotions, Stephen Curry demonstrated physical grit of his own. Before he lent heartfelt support to the grieving community that‚Äôs rattled by the death of Alex Pretti on Saturday (the day the game was originally scheduled for), Curry led the Warriors to a 111-85 win.
fullText:
While Minnesota is supercharged with emotions, Stephen Curry demonstrated physical grit of his own. Before he lent heartfelt support to the grieving community that‚Äôs rattled by the death of Alex Pretti on Saturday (the day the game was originally scheduled for), Curry led the Warriors to a 111-85 win. All while powering through injuries, getting hurt again, and adding another historic knotch to his resume.

Curry revealed he was following the goings-on in Minnesota while he spent Saturday resting his knee after the game was cancelled. He was listed as questionable before Sunday‚Äôs rescheduled game. But he played 28 minutes and was instrumental in the Dubs‚Äô turnaround. Another player stepped on his toe, but that didn‚Äôt seem to slow him down.

Given the circumstances, the Dubs and Wolves have a back-to-back rematch tomorrow. When asked if he would be available tomorrow, Curry said, ‚ÄúIf everything goes well, yeah. With the recovery and all that, the minutes tonight weren‚Äôt crazy, so hopefully I respond well.‚Äù

When the Golden State Warriors landed in Minnesota yesterday, some of the players got their workouts in before the game was canceled. The point guard hurt his knee during that. ‚ÄúKind of something flared up yesterday when we came over to get a workout in. It was super weird,‚Äù he revealed.

But his personal injury update is a lot more concerning when he reveals some persistent issues. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had stuff going on with quads and whatnot, but it was something that I hadn‚Äôt felt before. So, I definitely took advantage of the day off to get right, but hopefully that continues.‚Äù

After Jimmy Butler‚Äôs season-ending ACL tear, followed by Jonathan Kuminga‚Äôs indefinite break for bone bruising, the last thing Dub Nation can deal with is an injured Steph. Tomorrow De‚ÄôAnthony Melton and Al Horford sit out for injury management and fans wouldn‚Äôt mind if Steph joined them. Moving up the all-time scoring ladder can wait a little longer.

Despite battling injuries, Stephen Curry had an impressive 26 points, 2 rebounds, 7 assists, and 4 steals. That alone carried him to the 19th spot on the NBA‚Äôs All-time Scoring list. He passed John Havlicek and tied Paul Pierce for cracking the top 20 with 26,397 points in his career.

He‚Äôs only 99 points away from catching up to Tim Duncan next. So far this season, Curry has averaged 27.3 points, 5.0 assists, and 3.7 rebounds while shooting 46.8% from the field and 39.8% from the arc.

Analysts predict he‚Äôd crack top 10 soon enough. They, in fact, think he would‚Äôve done it a long time ago had it not been for his injury history that also kept him underpaid for a period of time.

Tonight, Curry limped during the empty moments and yet he carried the offense. If he aggravates what is now a sore knee and ends up missing more than one game, the Warriors‚Äô offense will be diminished.

For now even Steve Kerr is hopeful that Curry will be cleared to play. Steph is still listed as questionable for Monday and they‚Äôve left his status as a game-time decision.

The post Stephen Curry Shares Worrying Injury Update After Historic NBA Achievement Against Timberwolves appeared first on EssentiallySports.

title: The real reason why NBA postponed Warriors vs. Timberwolves matchup
description: The NBA postponed the Golden State Warriors‚Äô scheduled game against the Minnesota Timberwolves as concerns over public safety in Minneapolis grew following a nearby fatal shooting earlier in the day. The league said the decision was made to put community safety first amid unrest in the city.
fullText:
The NBA postponed the Golden State Warriors‚Äô scheduled game against the Minnesota Timberwolves as concerns over public safety in Minneapolis grew following a nearby fatal shooting earlier in the day.

The league said the decision was made to put community safety first amid unrest in the city.

The official NBA statement confirmed the postponement. ‚ÄúThe National Basketball Association game scheduled for today between the Golden State Warriors and Minnesota Timberwolves at Target Center has been postponed. The decision was made to prioritize the safety and security of the Minneapolis community.

‚ÄúThe game has been rescheduled for tomorrow (Jan. 25) at 5:30 PM ET at Target Center.‚Äù

The league‚Äôs announcement came as local authorities and community members were responding to significant unrest following the fatal shooting of a 37-year-old man by federal officers in downtown Minneapolis.

Protests and heightened tensions in the area around the Target Center were factors in the NBA‚Äôs choice to delay the matchup until the next day.

Authorities have publicly acknowledged the incident and the resulting community response, with protests and calls for accountability prompting safety concerns across downtown Minneapolis.

Given the proximity of the unrest and the potential risk to fans, players and staff, the NBA opted to delay the Warriors-Timberwolves game until conditions were expected to be more secure.

Postponements due to safety concerns are rare in the NBA, but the league‚Äôs priority in such situations is to ensure that events can proceed without risk to attendees or the surrounding community.

title: How good is Charles Bediako? Get to know controversial Alabama player returning to Tide after playing in NBA G League
description: Here is more on controversial Alabama basketball player Charles Bediako and his G-League career before returning to the Crimson Tide.
fullText:
How good is Charles Bediako? Get to know controversial Alabama player returning to Tide after playing in NBA G League originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The world of college basketball is changing. Through loopholes, players who have gone on to play professional basketball ‚Äî though not in the NBA ‚Äî have found ways to return to college and tap into unused eligibility.

One such player is Alabama‚Äôs Charles Bediako. If you recognize the name, it may be because the 7-foot center spent two seasons with the Crimson Tide from 2021 to 2023. After the conclusion of the 2022‚Äì23 season, he declared for the NBA Draft.

Bediako wasn't selected but has played in three seasons of the G League, with three different teams. He has now cited that he made a career mistake by leaving college, especially given how the NIL landscape has shifted. Bediako pointed toward international players who never made the NBA, being able to use their unused eligibility after playing overseas, and a temporary injunction was submitted, giving him permission to suit up once again for the Crimson Tide on Saturday, January 24.

Here is more on the controversial Bediako, and his return to Alabama after leaving the Crimson Tide for the G League.

SN's NCAAB HQ:¬†Scores | Schedule | Standings¬†| Latest Polls

Bediako is a 7-ft. center. He is a solid player, but his college stats from his first stint at Alabama suggest that he is fine, not great. From 2021 to 2023 he averaged 6.6 points, 5.2 rebounds and 19.3 minutes per game in 70 games. The Crimson Tide may use him more now if he has developed from his time in the G League, but it isn't like Alabama is getting back a former No. 1 overall pick.

Charles Bediako takes the floor for warmups to a warm welcome from the student section pic.twitter.com/zhrE1DI3ZH

‚Äî Katie Windham (@katiewindham_) January 24, 2026

Bediako played 46 games in the G League between 2023 and 2025. In that span, he averaged 21.3 minutes per game with 8.4 points and 8.0 rebounds. Bediako played better in the G League than he did at Alabama during his first stint, but it remains to be seen how his game will translate back to college.

Here is a look at Bediako's per-game G League stats.

Here is a look at Bediako's per-game college stats from his first stint with the Crimson Tide.

No. Bediako was not drafted. He opted to leave Alabama after the 2022-2023 season, but he went undrafted. Bediako signed with the San Antonio Spurs' G League team.

MORE: Why is Bediako allowed to return to college basketball?

In the 2021 class, 247Sports had Bediako ranked as the No. 35 player in the nation. He was considered the sixth-best center as well as the seventh-best player from Florida.

Among centers, he was ranked behind Chet Holmgren, Jalen Duren, Efton Reid, Nate Bittle and Enoch Boakye. In Florida, he was ranked behind Duren, Caleb Houstan, Moussa Diabate, Reid, Bittle, Tamar Bates and Benny Williams.

Bediako was born in Ontario, Canada, on March 10, 2002. As college ‚Äî and potentially professional ‚Äî basketball became an option, he began to move around.

He started his high school career at Ridley College in Ontario before transferring to Andrews Osborne Academy in Willoughby, Ohio. Bediako later transferred again, spending the remainder of his high school career at IMG Academy in Bradenton, Florida.

Bediako was born on March 10, 2002. He is 23 years old, and will turn 24 years old ahead of the 2026 NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament.

title: Minnesota Timberwolves postpone home game amid ICE protests
description: The NBA said the Minnesota Timberwolves home game against the Golden State Warriors on Saturday was postponed to prioritize safety.
fullText:
The Saturday game between the Golden State Warriors and Minnesota Timberwolves was postponed in a rare move by the National Basketball Association.

The Timberwolves were set to play the California team at Target Center in Minneapolis, a venue that has become a flash point for protests against the Trump administration's aggressive deportation tactics.

Hours before the scheduled game time, a 37-year-old Minneapolis man was fatally shot by federal agents, officials said in a joint press conference with the Department of Homeland Security and Customs and Border Protection agencies.

The NBA did not reference the shooting in its statement but said "the decision was made to prioritize the safety and security of the Minneapolis community."

The game was rescheduled to Sunday, 5:30 p.m. local time.

A decision to postpone an NBA game amid civil unrest is rare.

The last time the organization postponed a game during civil unrest was in 2020 after multiple teams, including the Milwaukee Bucks, boycotted games in response to the fatal shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

Spokespeople for the Timberwolves, Warriors, and NBA did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

title: Former UNC basketball sharpshooter thriving in NBA G League
description: Cormac Ryan was the best pure shooter on UNC's 2023-24 basketball squad. Ryan is now thriving in the NBA G League.
fullText:
The 2023-24 UNC basketball team is one of the program's best teams to never win a championship. Complete with an experienced, talented roster that showcased immense chemistry, how the season ended was a disappointment.

You might recognize a few names on this roster: RJ Davis, Armando Bacot and Harrison Ingram. All three dabbled with the NBA. Davis and Ingram are currently in the G League, while Bacot is playing overseas.

The best pure shooter on that 2023-24 North Carolina roster, though, is Cormac Ryan. Transferring in from Notre Dame during the prior offseason, Ryan finished his lone season in Carolina Blue second in 3-point percentage (.354) and free throw percentage (.874).

Now a member of the G-League's Wisconsin Herd, who are affiliated with the NBA's Milwaukee Bucks, Ryan is thriving in his second pro season.

Ryan is averaging 21.4 points per game on 50% field goal shooting, a 42% mark from deep and 90% mark from the free throw line.

The Herd are just 6-8 as of Saturday morning, but they have a true leader in Ryan. Question is: when will Milwaukee call Ryan up to make his NBA regular season debut?

It's no secret the 2025-26 Tar Heels could use Ryan's shooting prowess on their roster, particularly from the free throw line. UNC has its best frontcourt in years, led by Caleb Wilson and Henri Veesaar, but backcourt production is still coming into its own.

That 2023-24 North Carolina squad lost to Alabama in a heartbreaking, Sweet 16 result. Can the current Tar Heels make it a few steps deeper and bring a National Championship back to Chapel Hill?

title: NBA schedule for January 24: Matchups and predicted winners
description: Saturday‚Äôs NBA table is packed with games that can swing the standings in both conferences. Some teams are trying to stop losing streaks, while others want to protect their home floors. From an early afternoon clash in Philadelphia to a‚Ä¶
fullText:
Saturday‚Äôs NBA table is packed with games that can swing the standings in both conferences. Some teams are trying to stop losing streaks, while others want to protect their home floors. From an early afternoon clash in Philadelphia to a late-night tip in Utah, every matchup brings its own pressure and story. Here is a clear look at the games and the teams most likely to come out on top. (Odds via CBS Sports)

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: Spectrum Center, Charlotte

Washington enters on a rough stretch. The Wizards are 1-9 in their last 10 games and are allowing over 120 points per game in that span. Injuries have hit them hard, with Marvin Bagley III, Bilal Coulibaly, and Trae Young all sidelined. Scoring has become a problem without steady shooting and rebounding depth.

Charlotte is more stable at home and already beat Washington 126-109 in their last meeting. LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller continue to drive the offense, while Kon Knueppel is shooting over 48 percent from the field. The Hornets also defend better than Washington and force tougher shots. The double-digit spread reflects the gap in form and health. Charlotte should control this game from the second quarter onward.

Predicted winner: Charlotte Hornets

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: Xfinity Mobile Arena, Philadelphia

Philadelphia comes off an overtime win against Houston, but their recent run is mixed at 5-5 in the last 10 games. Tyrese Maxey remains the main scoring threat, and Joel Embiid has been steady but not dominant in recent outings.

New York has struggled against teams above .500, yet their shooting profile gives them an edge here. The Knicks average nearly 15 made three-pointers per game, which is more than Philadelphia usually allows. Karl-Anthony Towns leads them with over 20 points and 11 rebounds per game. The narrow spread shows how close this matchup is. Shot-making from deep and rebounding could tilt it toward New York late.

Predicted winner: New York Knicks

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: Target Center, Minneapolis

Minnesota has lost four straight games and has shown defensive leaks during that run. They still score well, averaging 120 points per game on the season, but stopping elite shooters remains a concern.

Golden State enters in better rhythm, winning six of its last ten. Stephen Curry continues to hit close to four threes per game, and the Warriors average over 122 points recently. The Timberwolves won the last meeting, but Curry scored 39 in that game. The plus points suggest a close contest. Experience and perimeter shooting give Golden State a real chance to steal this one on the road.

Predicted winner: Golden State Warriors

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Cleveland just beat Charlotte while holding them under 90 points. Donovan Mitchell led the way with 24 points, and the Cavs grabbed 60 rebounds in that game. Their defense forces turnovers and limits clean looks from three.

Orlando is coming off a heavy loss to Charlotte, allowing over 54 percent shooting. Paolo Banchero scored 23, but the Magic were outworked on both ends. Cleveland ranks sixth in scoring at over 119 points per game and also forces nearly 16 turnovers per night. With better form and more reliable shooting, Cleveland looks ready to edge Orlando even as a slight underdog.

Predicted winner: Cleveland Cavaliers

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Boston is strong on defense and sits second in the league in points allowed. Jaylen Brown just scored 30 against Indiana, while the team shot over 92 percent from the free-throw line. Their balance between scoring and defense keeps them steady on the road.

Chicago plays fast and ranks high in assists, but their defense gives up nearly 120 points per game. Coby White leads the offense, yet the Bulls allow too many open looks from outside. Boston‚Äôs ability to control pace and rebound should matter here. The small spread favors the more disciplined team. Boston should pull away late in the fourth.

Predicted winner: Boston Celtics

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: American Airlines Center, Dallas

Dallas has won three straight at home and has gone 7-3 in its last ten games. Cooper Flagg leads the team in scoring and rebounds, while Naji Marshall has added steady points in recent games. The Mavericks shoot well and protect home court better than their overall record suggests.

Los Angeles relies heavily on Luka Doncic, who is averaging over 33 points per game. The Lakers, however, are 4-6 in their last ten and have struggled with consistency. Dallas lost the first meeting, but this setting favors the home side. The points advantage and recent form make Dallas a solid pick.

Predicted winner: Dallas Mavericks

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: Delta Center, Salt Lake City

Utah has been leaky on defense but still scores well, averaging over 117 points per game in the last ten. Keyonte George leads the attack with more than 24 points per game. Home games have been more competitive for the Jazz.

Miami struggles on the road with an 8-15 away record. Their shooting has dipped below 44 percent in recent games, and they allow over 121 points per contest in the last ten. Utah‚Äôs pace and scoring should test Miami‚Äôs defense. The plus points suggest value on the home team. Utah has the edge in this matchup.

January 24 have some good games overall. Charlotte, Boston, and Cleveland look well positioned, while underdogs like Golden State, Dallas, and Utah have strong upset potential based on form and matchup stats. Fans should expect high-scoring games in Minnesota and Utah, with tighter contests in Philadelphia and Orlando.

title: Dillon Brooks Takes Aim at Aging LeBron James While Explaining Trash Talk Tactics
description: Over his 23 years in the NBA, LeBron James has had many rivals who have tried to get under his skin. However, arguably, none of them have been as successful in recent history as Phoenix Suns forward Dillon Brooks, a hard-nosed defensive specialist with erratic habits, someone who has consistently gotten a reaction out of the King.
fullText:
Over his 23 years in the NBA, LeBron James has had many rivals who have tried to get under his skin. However, arguably, none of them have been as successful in recent history as Phoenix Suns forward Dillon Brooks, a hard-nosed defensive specialist with erratic habits, someone who has consistently gotten a reaction out of the King. Now, Brooks has publicly addressed his tactics.

‚ÄúIf this was LeBron, maybe five years ago, then it‚Äôd be different,‚Äù Brooks said about James to Twitch streamer Agent during a recent appearance on his livestream. ‚ÄúMiami Bron, you‚Äôre not really talking shit to him for real, cause then it‚Äôs like, blow by, dunk. He‚Äôs got more game to him, more agile. Right now, he‚Äôs like, like I‚Äôve always been saying, he‚Äôs old.‚Äù

For Brooks, it‚Äôs clear that trash talk is just one more tactic that he uses as a part of his defensive identity, and a situational way to disrupt rhythm and force opposing stars into emotionally engage with him. Whether that approach is criticized or lauded has never seemed much to matter to him.

With the Phoenix Suns, even as he experiences as increased offensive role which averaging career-highs across the board, Brooks‚Äô defensive edge hasn‚Äôt softened. He presented his mindset as preparation, something he‚Äôs seen doing frequently before games, and a belief that every aspect of his opponent‚Äôs temperament and limitations factor into being able to stop them on defense.

‚ÄúYou can press up on him,‚Äù Brooks continued on James. ‚ÄúYou can cut him off spots so you know his moves he‚Äôs going to do. So you can always chirp a little bit. For some reason, he likes to do a little chirping‚Ä¶ I got like quick twitch back.‚Äù

When the Phoenix Suns and the Los Angeles Lakers met earlier this season, the tension between LeBron James and Dillon brooks was evident throughout the game. Brooks drew the James assignment for most of the game, playing extremely physically, crowding his space and talking throughout the night as the matchup felt almost playoff-like in it‚Äôs edge.

One key possession highlighted the double-edged approach of Brooks‚Äô tactics. With just over 12 seconds left in the game, the Suns forward drilled a go-ahead three right in James‚Äô face, seemingly validating his approach.

Almost immediately afterwards, James seemingly rolled over Brooks, resulting in a no-call, causing the two to get briefly entangled. Brooks was quickly assessed his second technical following this exchange and was ejected, a sequence that eventually snowballed into handing the Lakers a win from the late advantage.

Looking back, this game clearly reads as a real-time example of everything Brooks talked about on stream with Agent. He pressed up on James, cut off his preferred spots, leaned into constant chatter, and while James ultimately sealed the win late, the exchange highlighted why every matchup between the two is primetime.

Brooks isn‚Äôt just challenging perhaps the greatest player in league history, but actively pushing the margins of engaging against superstars.

The post Dillon Brooks Takes Aim at Aging LeBron James While Explaining Trash Talk Tactics appeared first on EssentiallySports.

title: Knicks Notes: Karl-Anthony Towns trade rumors, potential deadline acquisitions
description: On the Jan. 22 episode of The Putback with Ian Begley, SNY's NBA Insider and guest Michael Scotto of Hoops Hype discuss Karl-Anthony Towns trade rumors and potential deadline deals.
fullText:
With the 2026 NBA trade deadline arriving on Feb. 5, there are plenty of questions surrounding the Knicks and their NBA Finals expectations.

New York snapped their four-game losing streak in an impressive win over the Nets on Wednesday night, but the team is still in the midst of one of its worst stretches in the Jalen Brunson era. With the win, they are 3-9 over their last 12 games and have fallen into the No. 3 seed in the Eastern Conference -- they would be the four-seed if they didn't hold the tiebreaker over the Raptors.

So, as the Knicks look to improve the roster, what should fans be looking for? SNY NBA Insider Ian Begley spoke on the topic on the Jan. 22 episode of The Putback, where he and guest Michael Scotto of Hoops Hype broke down what they are hearing as the trade deadline gets closer.

After the Knicks' dreadful loss to the undermanned Mavericks at home on Monday, Newsday's Steve Popper reported that New York had spoken to a number of teams (Hornets, Grizzlies, Magic) about a potential trade involving Towns.

Towns' numbers are down pretty much across the board and the big man even admitted that he's had a tough time adjusting to head coach Mike Brown's system.

Begley shared on The Putback what he had heard.

"I checked around on this Monday, everything that I gathered is the Knicks are not having conversations about trading Karl-Anthony Towns," Begley said. "As of Monday, it was not happening. As far as something in the aftermath of that Dallas loss, no, that wasn‚Äôt the case."

Begley added that if the Knicks go through another 2-9 stretch and continue to struggle as they get closer to the trade deadline, things might change.

Whenever Towns' name is thrown out there as a trade candidate, the Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo is not far behind. It seems like an easy swap for both teams, but Scotto threw some cold water on the idea.

‚ÄúI personally never gotten the sense, at least from talking to my sources, that a team like the Milwaukee Bucks would be overly aggressive in trying to get Karl Towns in a Giannis Antetokounmpo package, theoretically," Scotto said.

Scotto suggested that the Knicks, if they were to deal Towns, would have to consider "breaking up" Towns' salary into multiple pieces, similar to what the Timberwolves did when they moved the big man to New York for Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo.

"I checked around on this Monday, everything that I gathered is the Knicks are not having conversations on trading Karl-Anthony Towns"

On The Putback with @IanBegley, Ian discusses what he's heard on the KAT reports and his read on if the Knicks would make that trade pic.twitter.com/bvLAdFjzt2

‚Äî Knicks Videos (@sny_knicks) January 22, 2026

Since a Towns trade is unlikely, what players should we be on the lookout for?

Guerschon Yabusele is as likely a candidate to be moved. According to Scotto, the acquisition was seen as a "homerun" by execs in the offseason, but it was made before the hiring of Brown. Clearly, Yabusele has had a tough time integrating into Brown's system, and the Knicks are looking to shop him. Scotto even suggested the Knicks may have to pair Yabusele with another minimum-salary player or draft picks to get a player that could help the team.

Scotto shared that the Pelicans have two players that the Knicks checked in.

"I did hear the Knicks were calling not only on Jose Alvarado of the New Orleans Pelicans but also Yves Missi," Scotto said. "Part of it could be doing background, doing due diligence, but you don't make calls on these guys unless you're intersted so that raised my antenna a little bit. If you take Yabusele and another minimum guy, you could maybe try to make something happen there."

The Knicks' interest in Alvarado is well-documented by Missi is a name that even Begley was surprised by.

Missi, 21, is a second-year center who has seen his minutes deep in year two. In his rookie campaign, Missi played around 27 minutes a game (73 games), averaging nine points, and eight rebounds (3.5 offensive). In his sophomore year, Missi is averaging 19 minutes and just 5.5 points and 5.5 rebounds (2.9 offensive) across 38 games.

Acquiring another big like Missi could open up more avenues for deals involving the Knicks. Would they deal Mitchell Robinson, who is on the final year of his contract, or one of the depth bigs like Ariel Hukporti? That also opens up the possibility to trade Towns as well.

The Knicks have a lot to consider as they hope to fortify their roster for the final stretch of the regular season and the playoffs.

"I did hear the Knicks were not only calling on Jose Alvarado of the New Orleans Pelicans, but also Yves Missi"

On today's episode of The Putback, @MikeAScotto - a must-follow for NBA fans - discusses trade deadline (link to full show in post below) pic.twitter.com/11wdozjICd

‚Äî Ian Begley (@IanBegley) January 22, 2026

title: NWSL star Trinity Rodman inks biggest women‚Äôs soccer deal in history
description: The NWSL has grown with U.S. Women‚Äôs National Team stars leading the way over the years, and now Trinity Rodman is being rewarded for those efforts. The daughter of former NBA star Dennis Rodman is signing a new contract with‚Ä¶
fullText:
The NWSL has grown with U.S. Women‚Äôs National Team stars leading the way over the years, and now Trinity Rodman is being rewarded for those efforts.

The daughter of former NBA star Dennis Rodman is signing a new contract with the Washington Spirit. That deal will make her the highest-paid player in women‚Äôs soccer history.

According to Trinity Rodman‚Äôs agent Mike Senkowski of Upper 90 Sports, her new three-year contract with the Spirit will pay her an annual salary of over $1 million. Meanwhile, the highest-paid men‚Äôs player in the world is Cristiano Ronaldo, who made over $260 million in 2025, per Sportico.

Breaking: Trinity Rodman has signed a new three-year contract with the Washington Spirit. 

Rodman's new multi-million dollar deal comes with an annual salary of $1 million, making her the highest paid women's soccer player in the world, according to her agent. pic.twitter.com/MtU6FalWtL

‚Äî ESPN (@espn) January 22, 2026

The 23 year old has taken the NWSL by storm since her professional debut in 2021. She‚Äôs also become a staple of the USWNT with over 47 appearances already in just four years.

‚ÄúIt feels amazing, I‚Äôm very happy, I‚Äôm very blessed,‚Äù Rodman stated after signing her record deal. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs a monumental and game-changing moment right now. I can‚Äôt even describe in words what it feels like. Obviously everyone‚Äôs going to have their different thoughts and opinions about it, but I‚Äôve never really cared. So that doesn‚Äôt change anything for me.‚Äù

Women‚Äôs soccer has seen many high-profile players move to top European clubs in recent seasons, however, Rodman‚Äôs deal shows NWSL has a willingness to pay top dollar to keep its stars.

The Portland Thorns recently paid Sophia Wilson $1 million, but Rodman‚Äôs new contract will exceed that deal.

title: Ex-NBA player says dating Khloe Kardashian 'derailed' his career
description: Rashad McCants, who played for the Minnesota Timberwolves, explained how dating a Kardashian messed him up profesionally.
fullText:
Ex-NBA player says dating Khloe Kardashian 'derailed' his career originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Former NBA guard Rashad McCants says his brief relationship with Khloe Kardashian came at a cost he believes went far beyond tabloid attention. In his view, the timing and culture of the league during his playing days turned off-court visibility into a professional liability.

McCants, who was drafted by the Minnesota Timberwolves in 2005, has said that players in his era were expected to keep a low profile unless they were established superstars. Any perceived distraction, he argues, could quickly be held against someone still trying to secure a foothold in the league.

MORE:¬†Miami fans think adult film star Abella Danger is dating Carson Beck because of a viral fake tweet

Speaking with Basketball Network‚Äôs Nick Raguz, McCants explained how celebrity relationships were viewed differently before the rise of social media and player branding. ‚ÄúBefore, it was a distraction,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe powers didn‚Äôt want players doing anything outside of the NBA that would be considered a distraction. You didn‚Äôt see a lot of guys dating celebrities unless they were high-profile players.‚Äù

According to McCants, that distinction mattered. Playing in a small market while dating someone already famous brought scrutiny he felt he couldn‚Äôt afford. ‚ÄúFor me, not being a high-profile guy and being in Minnesota, it was more of a distraction than a compliment,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI was one of the early bloomers for all of those things, and it didn‚Äôt help my situation.‚Äù

On the court, McCants‚Äô NBA run was short and uneven. Injuries and inconsistent minutes limited his opportunities, and he averaged 9.9 points per game across four seasons with the Timberwolves. As teams turned over rosters and leaned toward younger players, his role diminished, and his NBA career ended after the 2008-09 season.

MORE:¬†Klay Thompson shows up to support Megan Thee Stallion's latest Dunkin promo

The former guard also pointed to how much the league has changed since then. Today‚Äôs NBA encourages players to build brands, embrace social media, and expand their visibility, regardless of market size. In McCants‚Äô telling, that shift highlights how different the environment was when he was trying to establish himself.

title: Lakers vs Clippers Prediction, Picks & Best Bets for Tonight‚Äôs NBA Game
description: Get the best Lakers vs. Clippers predictions ahead of tonight's battle of L.A. at the Intuit Dome. Free NBA picks for January 22.
fullText:
As we hit the halfway point in the NBA schedule, the Los Angeles Clippers finally seem to be salvaging their season, but that progress will be tested tonight when they host the Los Angeles Lakers at Intuit Dome.

The Battle of L.A. season series sits at 1-1 heading into this matchup, and my Lakers vs. Clippers predictions expect LeBron James to be one of the swing factors.

Let's dive right into my NBA picks for Thursday, January 22.

Lakers vs Clippers best bet: LeBron James Over 12.5 rebounds + assists (-112 bet365)

LeBron James' injury issues may point to a 41-year-old in his 23rd season, but his stat lines suggest he‚Äôs got something left in the tank. James has been able to keep his sciatica and arthritis at bay while starting 2026 with a bang, so look for his fingerprints to be all over tonight‚Äôs clash with the Los Angeles Clippers.

With Luka Doncic doing so much of the scoring for the Los Angeles Lakers, I‚Äôm targeting LeBron‚Äôs rebounds and assists here, and he‚Äôs gone past this combo O/U number in four of his past five outings.

James has been getting the job done in both these categories so far this month, with averages of 7.7 RPG and 7.6 APG in January, and he was closing in on a triple-double in L.A.‚Äôs win over the Denver Nuggets earlier this week.

Until Austin Reaves returns, LeBron is going to have a larger share of the playmaking, particularly when Luka is on the bench, and there‚Äôs just not a lot of secondary ball-handling in the current rotation. Equally, he‚Äôs got a big role to play alongside Deandre Ayton on the boards.

At this stage of his career, James can still do the little things that drive winning, and the Lakers will need all of that veteran savvy to hold off their cross-city rivals tonight.

The Lakers are 7-3 SU in their last 10 meetings with the Clippers, and an impressive 14-8 on the road this season. With Kawhi Leonard still listed as questionable, the burden on James Harden could once again be massive, and the hosts gave up 138 points to the Chicago Bulls this week.

Harden continues to put up big numbers, and I‚Äôll take the Over on his rebounds prop here. He‚Äôs grabbed 4+ boards in six of his last seven games, and the Clippers will gladly keep him closer to the rim if it avoids the Luka defensive assignment.

Ivica Zubac has had some miserable possessions trying to guard Doncic on switches in the past, but the Clippers will lean on him for big minutes here. Zubac has posted three straight double-doubles, and he‚Äôs finished with 11+ rebounds in his last four games.

Spread: Lakers -1.5 (+100) | Clippers +1.5 (-120)

Moneyline: Lakers -110 | Clippers -110

Over/Under: Over 223.5 (-110) | Under 223.5 (-110)

title: Boston Celtics legend Larry Bird weighs in on the NBA's 3-point revolution
description: Bird had his own ideas about what the league ought to do about the growing rate of shots coming from beyond the arc.
fullText:
There have been concerns in NBA circles about the 3-point shot in the league almost as long as there has been one. And, present for the first-ever trey sunk in the history of the Association, Hall of Fame Boston Celtics forward Larry Bird had his own ideas about what the league ought to do about the growing rate of shots coming from beyond the arc.

One can argue he played well before it ever reached anything close to the volume of the modern game, but who is not going to listen to the Hick From French Lick when it comes to basketball? The folks behind the "Basketball Network" YouTube channel put together a clip dialing in on Bird's thoughts about what ought to be done regarding the explosion of 3-point shots in the league.
